subject: RE: [junit] Smalltalk was: Re: how to use ExceptionTestCase ?
msgSnippet: Another data point: We have seen demand for our automated testing tools for Smalltalk increase in the last 6-9 months, both from existing customers and new
messageBody:
Another data point: We have seen demand for our automated testing tools
for Smalltalk increase in the last 6-9 months, both from existing
customers and new customers.

-----------------------------
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The Object Testing Company
www.silvermark.com
**********************************
* Providers of the "Test Mentor" *
* family of testing tools *
**********************************

> From: Johannes Link [mailto:john.link@...]

> > > Yes! If only someone would pay me for programming in
> Smalltalk... :( ;)
> >
> > It seems to me making a comeback. Dynamic languages in generally
> look
> > to be getting more popular.. and of course, Smalltalk is the
> grandaddy
> > of all dymnamic languages (both in terms of ancestry and sheer
> power).
>
> You might be right. I recently had to translate my TDD Java training
> to Smalltalk for one of our customers. I'm still waiting for the
> second Smalltak training though.
>
> Johannes
